name: Hotel Galvez & Spa, A Wyndham Grand Hotel

reviews.title: Lovely, but VERY Small Rooms
reviews.text: In early July 2006, my mother, my two children, and I stayed at the Hotel Galvez in Galveston for three nights. I had called the hotel directly for a reservation and was given one rate but before confirming the reservation I called the toll-free reservation number for Wyndham and received a much better rate. I requested a room with two queens and a gulf view. Be warned that the pictures on the website make the rooms appear much larger than they are. The room was very small. Really too small for four people. There was only one chair and I requested another, which was brought up promptly. The hotel is lovely and the lobby is like going back in time. The staff was friendly and didn't seem annoyed with all of my "tourist" questions.

We did eat at restaurant one time for lunch. There was just us and one other party in the restaurant. We weren't sure what to expect with the food but we were very pleased. The food was wonderful. Some of the best we had in Galveston. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. Be sure to ask about other items that are not on the menu. I was able to order burgers for the kids and burgers are not on the menu.
reviews.title: Beautiful Lobby, Small Rooms, Left Me Wanting More For My Money
Awesome!
reviews.text: When booking your room, be sure to ask for a gulf view. Only downside is that it is $20 a night more but otherwise, you will be looking at a parking lot and some old buildings. We opted to do the free self-parking in the lot behind the hotel. Just be warned that there is not a ramp at the back entrance of the hotel (isn't this required for ADA?) so if you have a lot of luggage or packages, going up the many steps can be a problem. Also, when making the reservation I was told that the pool is heated. Maybe it normally is but it wasn't during our visit, and we tried it every day. In fact, the water was ice cold.

reviews.title: They didn't tell us it was haunted
reviews.text: Over all, we really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Galvez and are likely to return.

reviews.title: It's Galveston Folks, Relax
reviews.text: We have visited and stayed in Galveston at least once a year, for the past Seven years. Typically we stay at Moody Gardens. We thought that we would try something different this time.

We just returned from a one-night stay in the Hotel Galvez. Overall I was very pleased with our stay. I booked through Hotwire and got a rate of $120 a night for 2 adults and 1 child. I was going on a short vacation with my mom who was visiting from out of town and my 2-year-old daughter. The hotel is very historic but well maintained. The staff is friendly and they allowed us to check in about 3 hours early. I asked for an upgraded room and they gave us an ocean view room on the 6th floor. The room was small but adequate for sleeping and getting dressed in the morning. We had a great time in the pool and hot tub. Also, there was a nice swim up bar. The day we left they let us check out late, which was great because we were having fun swimming. We were there on a Thursday night so the hotel didn’t seem busy. We didn’t eat in the hotel but the restaurant looked very nice. The only complaint that I had was that the shower didn’t get hot enough. The water wasn’t even lukewarm. We had a fun time and I am looking forward to taking my husband there for a romantic weekend one of these days.
reviews.title: Great Historic Hotel

likes.disliked: — Water wasn't hot in the shower

reviews.text: My family stayed here for 2 days before we left on our cruise. Compared to many of the surrounding hotels in Galveston, it is very well-maintained, clean, and overall a good value for the AAA rate that we paid. The hotel is a HISTORIC hotel so the rooms are going to be smaller than what some may be used to, but our family of 5 (2 adults, 3 kids) did NOT feel cramped at all. We had a great oceanview room on the 6th floor, a comfortable bed, a clean bathroom, and plenty of towels for swimming. The pool is clean and very well-maintained, as well. If you sign up for their FREE Wyndham By Request Membership on their website, you can request free wine/liquor/cola and snacks to be available on the day you arrive. Also, as a member, you get free Wi-Fi internet access (my husband loved it). We had our requested half-size bottle of Chardonnay, plate of fresh fruit (oranges, apples, strawberries), and 2 free bottled waters as part of the FREE membership. And, as a member, you get a 2pm checkout as opposed to the usual 12 pm. The beach is right across the street. The breakfast buffet had the standard breakfast food (sausages, pancakes, fruit, etc.) for an additional $12/person; kids under 5 are free. Finally, if you are going on a cruise, the shuttle to the pier is FREE. You can valet your car the night before for a $10 or self-park FREE in their gated (i.e. secured) parking garage. They start transporting cruisers at 11 am, and don't charge for extra passengers (beyond 2) as some other hotels do. Upon arrival from the cruise, you wait right in front of the port terminal (just outside customs--no need to walk out in the hot sun) and they'll pick you up and bring you back to the hotel. We only had to wait 5-10 minutes. We will definitely be coming back to this hotel on our next cruise.
reviews.title: Great historic hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I usually am very positive about the experiences I have had in hotels. I am not very picky and I know I get what I pay for. However, this was not the case when I booked at the Hotel Galvez. My wife and I paid close to $200 dollars for a room at the Galvez and we came away wishing we hadn't. We had no problems with the staff, the decor of the hotel, the location, or room service. The reason we would not recommend this hotel is because you don't get what you pay for. The room was tiny. I thought for a price like I paid we'd be getting a room far larger than we received. The rooms were very small, they resembled the size of European hotel rooms.
reviews.title: Not Close To Being Worth the Money

likes.disliked: — Price and small rooms with paper thin walls

reviews.text: Also, the walls inside the hotel were paper thin. Anytime a person walked through the hallway you could hear every conversation. Everytime a person opened and closed the door you'd hear it with a loud resounding thump. The maid service also closed and opened their utility door without thinking that people were still sleeping.
reviews.title: Best Experience ever!!!!!

reviews.text: Positives: Like I said the location was good, their was complimentary parking, great room service, and nice decor.
reviews.title: Hotel was nice, historic

reviews.text: Negatives: Size of rooms, lack of peace due to paper thin walls, and too expensive.
reviews.title: Just O.K.

reviews.text: Consider reserving somewhere else, that's my honest opinion. Good luck to all and happy travels.
reviews.title: Elegant decor, and overall great service.

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Hotel Galvez on our quick weekend trip to Galveston. The hotel was really nice. The staff was helpful with all our needs and we did not experience any of the problem other have warned about. Be sure to check out the pool. They have two hot tubs and a nice swim up bar. The only real complant I have is I felt we over paid a little of the room but it was understandable because it was during Spring Break for many colleges. Overall, if we are able to get a room a few dollars cheaper, I am sure we will be back.
reviews.title: Nice Weekend
very disappointed
reviews.text: When we made our reservation we requested a room with a view of the ocean and a king size bed. When we arrived they told us their computers were down and they did not know what rooms were available but finally said they had a room with a queen bed. We accepted it and were shocked at how small the room and the bed was. The main view was the roof and the only view of the ocean was if you stood in the corner and looked to the left. We called and said we definitely needed a king bed and that the view was not of the ocean. She said they considered it an ocean view. After 2 hours we were moved to the very last room in the rear of the hotel facing the parking lot. It was bigger but it had no table or chairs and a king size headboard with a queen bed. My husband is 6'6" and we really need a king. The next day we came back to the hotel after sightseeing and wanted to take a nap. On both sides of us and down the hall there was construction going on with sawing and hammering for hours. The construction woke us up the next morning at 7:30am . We also tried to watch an in room movie and it would not work so we had to call the front desk and they had to fix that. We also took a bottle of water that was sitting with our ice bucket out of the hotel while sightseeing and was charged $4.50 for it. The coke machine was $1.50 and would not take our dollar bills and we had to track down a maid for change. When we checked out we told them about the constuction and they acted so surprised. They also said the beds seemed smaller because they were pillowtops. Could have stayed somewhere much cheaper and even had a refrig and table with a king size bed.

reviews.title: Great Historic Hotel
reviews.text: We took a Texas Road Trip in July. Our first stop after flying into Houston was a three night stay at the hotel Galvez. The lobby of this Hotel is absolutely beautiful. The pool is one of the nicest I have ever experienced. Our Room was very nice even though our view was the back parking lot. There were several very nice restaurants within walking distance.
The beach left a little to be desired but overall the Hotel and it's accomodations were exemplary. There was valet parking available but parking was very close to the hotel and very accessible.
reviews.title: No sleep at this Inn

reviews.text: We checked in on time. The valets never offered to help us or my elderly in-laws. We unloaded the luggage, and never once during our stay did anyone offer to park our car or open a door for us. My husband reserved 2 rooms facing the water. At check-in he was informed that the rooms facing the water would be an extra $40. Our room had 2 robes-his parents had none. No one turned down our bed or left mints on the pillows as I had read about in previous reviews. Our room had mildew, and something black around the handles on the bathroom sink. But, this is an old hotel so no big deal. What I did not expect was the room full of people next door having a party. If you want to get some sleep-don’t stay at this hotel! The thin doors make a lot of noise when closed. Someone must have complained about the noise because security came and you could hear everything that was said. Including the constant stream of the F-word before and after security left. On a positive note the Sunday brunch was wonderful, the food was excellent the service was not. Although the restaurant was not full, the waiter had to be asked 3 times to bring drinks, and refills never came unless you asked another waiter as he walked by. The architecture of the first floor of the hotel is beautiful, but overall the Wyndham Hotel Galvez is substandard-not because it is old-but because of bad service. We will not stay here again.
reviews.title: Good, but could be better.

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from galveston. We went to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel looks alot bigger online. We paid the extra money for the oceanview. We thought our room would look like the picture. It had a bed, nightstand, and table. We didnt get 2 windows and we didnt have a little couch as the picture shows. The wallpaper was peeling, and it had black around the edges in the bathroom. The lobby is beautiful, and the staff was great. The pool was gorgeous. The hotel rooms could use some TLC to match the lobby, and pool. It was nice but DEFINITELY not worth the 224.00 a night we paid. Alot of the hotels on seawall were probably nicer and a TON cheaper and probably included breakfast. Menu prices were outrageous. I ordered a strawberry daquiri by pool and it was 15.00 my husband ordered Creme Brulee and a coke and it was 15.00. All in all save your money on a hotel and keep more for spending we had a blast walking around town and site seeing.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights before a cruise with our two fourteen year olds in an adjacent room. The ambiance of this hotel is lovely. We had read the reviews...some with caution. The rooms are small...go figure, this is a historic well cared for hotel. If you need a personal refridgerator, stay home. Otherwise, this hotel met, and in some areas exceeded, our expectations. The pool is great, however there is road noise that is easily obscured by the fountain on one side and the hot tub jets on the other. The sea wall area is nice to walk along. The food in the hotel is fine. The Hyatt is one of our favorite hotels to stay at, the Hotel Galvez was comparable. The strand shopping is on the upswing, and was a pleasant way to spend an afternoon. The staff was friendly, the rooms quiet, the beds comfortable. I would definately stay again. The hotel looks just like the website photos.
reviews.title: no worries

reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of April. The building is stunning - a beautiful lobby, reception area and restaurant (we didn't eat there) but the bedrooms are very, very disappointing. The first room we were given overlooked the neighbourhood at the back and the room was dark, damp and smelly with peeling wallpaper around the window. We were moved and were given a room overlooking the sea. View was fabulous and although the room was slightly better it still smelt damp. Small, cramped bathroom and dark, drab, out-dated furnishings in the room made it a very unwelcoming place to be. The pool area was lovely, even though half of it was closed. The verandah was a nice place to sit - much better than spending time in the room. .At the end of our stay we were charged $10 for parking; at check-in they hadn't asked if we had a car but at check-out they assumed we'd used valet parking and had added the charge. As we hadn't, they took it off the bill. We enjoyed Galveston but we wouldn't stay at this hotel again, nor would we recommend it. Room refurbishment should be a majpr priority at this hotel.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

reviews.text: My family and I (we had three rooms) stayed at the Hotel Galvez prior to our cruise. The Hotel was beautiful and the rooms were clean and updated. Everyone enjoyed wearing the terry robes. The staff was very friendly, informative and went out of their way to accommodate us. We asked and the hotel provided a shuttle free of charge for our family to the Strand District for dinner. The weather was cool and we were not able to enjoy the beautiful pool area. We will definitely return. I am glad I did not let negative reviews influence our decision to stay here. It was great!
reviews.title: A wonderful stay
Don't judge a book by its cover; a hotel either!
reviews.text: The Hotel Galvez is beautiful on the outside, and so are the pictures of the inside, online. But the inside when you actually get there, smells old and musty, the front desk people were very rude and unhelpful, and the standard room (not the picture that you see on the website) was the size of a shoebox filled with a king size bed. Our "view" overlooked the rotting projects and the only sound that we could hear were the dogs barking in the neighborhoods. There was construction going on throughout most of the hotel, the swim up bar and most of the pool area was closed, on one of the days, the electricity went out for about 2 hours and people were stuck on the elevators that whole time. When we asked if we could switch rooms due to the construction and the view, the staff was not at all willing to accomodate our request. However, the remaining pool area was nice with lush greenery and swaying palms. There were two jacuzzis's heated perfectly and a large pool that was heated as well, but only mildly. Needless to say, we spent pretty much all of our time at the pool b/c the beach in front of the hotel was littered with trash. Overall, no we would never stay at this hotel again. We were expecting a much nicer experience than we received, so we were pretty disappointed.
Beautiful hotel across the street from the beach. Immaculate and fancy southern-style hotel. Beautiful rooms, excellent service, even the food in the hotel restaurant was outstanding.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

likes.liked: — Every detail of the hotel was beautiful.
likes.disliked: — Try the hotel restaurant at least once!

reviews.text: We stayed here on our Texas tour last March. Had never been to the gulf before or Texas. This hotel really gave you the sense of the past and the grand old days of the twenties. The service was great, received our Wyndham By Request treats on arrival. I found the front desk staff a bit cold on occasion but room service, concierge were very friendly. The property is right across from the ocean so we had a great view. The pool area was excellent, our teenage boys enjoyed it too. Room was a bit small but that was to be expected given the age of the property. It was in very good condition and very clean. Will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Beautiful historic property

likes.liked: — The historical value of the property.

reviews.text: Good restaurants around, don't try to go the Rainforest Cafe unless you want to stand in line with mobs of people. The duckboat tour was fun.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

likes.liked: — Room decor: linens, pillows, bed were great!
likes.disliked: — Dark garage and lack of a business center.

reviews.text: Stayed 4 days in this hotel. They currently have construction going on, and though it did not greatly effect our stay, ( No fitness or Business Center currently availble) it was not indicated in the Hotels.com listing. The room was lovely, a bit on the small side (to be expected in an historic building such as this) but fine for a couple. Probably not as good a choice for a large group or family. The room was clean and all furnishings were quite nice, appearing to be practically new. The hotel is within blocks of lots of good dining and directly across the street from the Gulf of Mexico. Optional self-serve parking in garage next door was ok, and less expenisve then valet parking, but the garage is not well lit and didn't feel particularly safe at night. The staff was professional, friendly and helpful. Overall this was abeautiful hotel and a great stay. I would definately recommend this hotel and would definatley stay here again on a future trip.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

likes.liked: — The lobby and pool area were beautiful.

reviews.text: I was hesitant about the Hotel Galvez after seeing reviews on this site, but I really wanted to stay at this historic hotel so I booked it anyway. The location is great and the hotel is beautiful. It has a very pretty lobby and pool area. The restaurant did not have a very extensive menu so I ended up going to another restaurant for dinner. However, the bar area was nice. I was pleasantly surprised with the room. While small, it was comfortable and I had a great view of the gulf. The room was very tastefully decorated and the bathroom was clean and had all the needed amenities. I would definitely stay here again when visiting the area.
reviews.title: Lovely Place but I got sick

likes.disliked: — The moldy air conditioning blowing on me and making me sick

reviews.title: this was a great hotel
reviews.text: The next morning I asked the front desk and they said many people have had similar experiences and it's to be expected in an old hotel. Well Not By Me! When we returned home I did an internet search and learned the wing we stayed in is on the Haunted Galveston tour and the room my sister in law stayed in beside me, room 505, is considered to be the "evil" room in the hotel according to numerous web sites (she did not have any experiences and ridiculed me until we got home and read all the info on the internet).
Unless you are seeking an experience beyond our world I would recommend a different hotel, or at least stay away from the fifth floor!
reviews.title: I will never stay there again.

reviews.text: Don't come here expecting the Four Seasons Nevis and you will have a blast. The pool is fantastic, service is good and it really feels like a getaway. Where else can you get lunch and a beerl poolside for $8? There's a laid-back fun vibe here. Don't bother going to the beach which just isn't pleasant in this part of Galveston. Sunday brunch is a must. Everyone was helpful and friendly. The lobby bar is a fun place to convene late into the night. The room is nothing spectacular but clean and nice enough. Again folks, it's a Wyndham so keep your expectations appropriate and you will be pleased.
reviews.title: Old hotel

reviews.text: We stayed 2 days at the Galvez before our cruise. Let me just say that this hotel is beautiful. Very well maintained and if you want to be pampered this is the place to go!! We had booked 2 rooms and had requested that they be next to each other, with gulf view. Didn't expect gulf view since those rooms were more expensive. We had arrived at the hotel 2 hrs before check in and was told they would call us on my cell when the rooms were ready that way we could go ahead and leave and explore Galveston. Let me just note that there was always someone there to help with the luggage, open car doors, and the hotel doors ect. Staff was very friendly and willing to help. About 2 hrs later they called to tell me the room was ready. We returned to the hotel and was told we would have 2 city view rooms side by side. Upon checking in discovered we had been split up onto 2 different floors but before I could even say anything the front desk rep stepped in and fixed it. Not only fixed it but upgraded us to a gulf view!!! (for 1 room that ended up across the hall from the other room) Once in our room (there small but hey this is an old hotel) we were very happy view was beautiful (6th floor) and room was very nice. The bed was to die for the best sleep ever!! My best friend needed a fan to sleep at night called the front desk said they would send one up. They called back to say they had sent someone to Walmart to buy one and it would be up shortly, and at no cost to us!!! Unbelievable service!!! I was originally told that the roll away bed would be $10 nt charge at check in was told no charge. Also parking for the duration of the cruise was told $10, again no charge. We made good use of the pool bar and the Jacuzzi's were great!!! This hotel went
reviews.title: Loved The Galvez!!!

likes.disliked: — High priced but all of Galveston is this time of the year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: well beyond my expectations and we will be staying there again during our next cruise in 2007!!!!!!!
reviews.title: A haunted, musty-smelling, matchbox sized room

likes.liked: — The hotel was very clean, great looking landscape, interesting history
likes.disliked: — Valet! And rooms similar in size to that of a cruise ship...possibly smaller.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just got back today from our honeymoon stay at the Galvez, and I must say we were extremely disappointed. I will say some nice things about the Galvez first. As most reviewers say on here, the lobby was beautiful, and so was the pool. (Even though it was closed our entire stay) We had lunch in the restaurant and it was pricey, but the service was good and the food was excellent. The front desk also tried to accommodate our grievances as much as possible. Okay, that's about it.
reviews.title: Very Nice

likes.disliked: — even though the restaurant had great food, plan to eat elsewhere and save a bundle.

aka: Hotel Galvez And Spa, a Wyndham Grand Hotel
description: Hotel Galvez & Spa, A Wyndham Grand® Hotel and National Trust Historic Hotel of America, is the only historic beachfront hotel on the Texas Gulf Coast. This 224-room, century-old hotel offers 13,000 square feet of meeting space, a 9,763-square-foot spa, fitness center, full-service restaurant, lobby bar and pool with a swim-up bar. The hotel is rated four diamonds by AAA and is owned by Galveston preservationist George Mitchell as part of Mitchell Historic Properties.
